revised_title: The Identification of Muriatic Acid in Animal Stomachs
tldr: William Prout investigates the acid and saline matters present in animal stomachs, specifically the muriatic acid and its role in digestion. He conducts experiments on a rabbit's stomach and concludes that a significant amount of unsaturated muriatic acid exists during digestion. Prout also infers that muriatic acid performs the same function in the human stomach.
